data: When I came up to town for my second year, my aunt Hoggarty made me a present of a diamond-pin; that is to say, it was not a diamond-pin then, but a large old-fashioned locket, of Dublin manufacture in the year 1795, which the late Mr. Hoggarty used to sport at the Lord Lieutenantâ€™s balls and elsewhere.
The History of Samuel Titmarsh and the Great Hoggarty Diamond
